title: Gazebo does not start if the GAZEBO_RESOURCE_PATH enviromental variable is set

content.raw:
I am using Gazebo from default branch. If you try to start it with:
~~~
GAZEBO_RESOURCE_PATH="" gazebo
~~~
it loads correctly. 

However if you try to set `GAZEBO_RESOURCE_PATH` to a meaningful variable, for example to load some world file in a given directory, it fails:


~~~bash
pegua@pareto:/usr/local/share/gazebo$ GAZEBO_RESOURCE_PATH="${GAZEBO_RESOURCE_PATH}:/home/pegua" gazebo --verbose
Gazebo multi-robot simulator, version 6.0.0
Copyright (C) 2012-2015 Open Source Robotics Foundation.
Released under the Apache 2 License.
http://gazebosim.org

[Msg] Waiting for master.
Gazebo multi-robot simulator, version 6.0.0
Copyright (C) 2012-2015 Open Source Robotics Foundation.
Released under the Apache 2 License.
http://gazebosim.org

[Msg] Waiting for master.
[Msg] Connected to gazebo master @ http://127.0.0.1:11345
[Msg] Publicized address: 10.255.36.56
[Err] [RTShaderSystem.cc:440] Unable to find shader lib. Shader generating will fail.[Err] [Server.cc:318] Could not open file[worlds/empty.world]
~~~



Sourcing `/usr/local/share/gazebo/setup.sh` before launching `GAZEBO_RESOURCE_PATH="${GAZEBO_RESOURCE_PATH}:/home/pegua" gazebo --verbose` (i.e. setting `GAZEBO_RESOURCE_PATH` to the default path) solves the issue, but it is an undocumented procedure.
